required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neurogenic Detrusor Overactivity Following Spinal Cord Injury or Multiple Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IIa, Multicentre, Double Blind, Single Dose, Parallel Group, Placebo Controlled, Clinical Pilot Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of a Single Dose, Intra-Detrusor Injections of 750 Units of Dysport® in Subjects Suffering From Neurogenic Detrusor Overactivity Following Spinal Cord Injury or Multiple Sclerosis.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy and safety of a single dose of 750 U of Dysport compared to placebo for the improvement in the daily incontinence episode frequency for each administration mode in subjects suffering from neurogenic detrusor overactivity following spinal cord injury or multiple sclerosis.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

secondary_outcome.description: Maximum Cystometric Capacity is an urodynamic parameter that indicates the volume at which a patient feels he (she) can no longer delay release of urine from the urinary bladder. Baseline urodynamics exams done at screening visit.

Maximum Detrusor Pressure is an urodynamic parameter that is the maximum value of the pressure within the bladder which is measured during the filling phase of the urodynamic exam. Baseline urodynamics exams done at screening visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician's Global Assessment Score of Treatment Response
secondary_outcome.description: The subject's treatment response was assessed by the physician and graded as 'markedly worse', 'much worse', 'worse', 'slightly worse', 'no change', 'slightly improved', 'improved', 'much improved', or 'markedly improved'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician's Global Assessment Score of Treatment Response
secondary_outcome.description: The subject's treatment response was assessed by the physician and graded as 'markedly worse', 'much worse', 'worse', 'slightly worse', 'no change', 'slightly improved', 'improved', 'much improved', or 'markedly improved'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician's Global Assessment Score of Treatment Response
secondary_outcome.description: The subject's treatment response was assessed by the physician and graded as 'markedly worse', 'much worse', 'worse', 'slightly worse', 'no change', 'slightly improved', 'improved', 'much improved', or 'markedly improved'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life (QoL) Total Summary Score
secondary_outcome.description: Mean Change from Baseline in Short Form (SF)-Qualiveen Questionnaire Calculated Total Score. The SF-Qualiveen questionnaire is a specific health related QoL questionnaire validated for urinary disorders in subjects with neurological conditions containing 8 items looking at four scales: limitations (2 items); constraints (2 items); fears (2 items) and feelings (2 items). The 8 items each having a 5-point Likert-type scale ranging from 0="Not at all" to 4="Extremely" for the first 6 items, from 0="Never" to 4="Always" for item 7 and from 0="Always" to 4="Never" for item 8. The score per scale has been calculated as the mean of the two items. In case of one missing item among the 2 items for a given scale, the score has not been calculated. Total score has been calculated as the mean of all the items completed among the 8 items. Lower scores indicate a better QoL (i.e. no limitations, fears, constraints, or negative feelings) and higher scores indicate poorer QoL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Score: Before Treatment Injection
secondary_outcome.description: Pain assessment using the VAS. The VAS is a 100-mm (10-cm) scoring scale. Score range on VAS is from 0 to 100 where zero [0] indicates no pain and 100 indicates worst possible pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Score: During Treatment Injection Procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Pain assessment using the VAS. The VAS is a 100-mm (10-cm) scoring scale. Score range on VAS is from 0 to 100 where zero [0] indicates no pain and 100 indicates worst possible pain.

intervention.description: 750 U intra detrusor injection on Day 1 (single dose)
Intra detrusor injection on Day 1 (single dose)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject, family member or care giver was willing and able to perform clean intermittent catheterisation (CIC) for the duration of the study
- Inadequate response or refractory to anticholinergic medication
- Botulinum Toxin naive for intradetrusor injections and with no previous treatment with Botulinum Toxin of any type, within 3 months prior to study entry for any other condition
- Have a minimum of 2 incontinences per day calculated as the average daily incontinence episode frequency (IEF) over the 3 days preceding the baseline visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant Baseline renal and/or urinary tract pathology
- Previous treatment with any endovesical pharmacology agent including detrusor Botulinum Toxin injection

facility.name: Hôpital Lyon Sud -Hospices Civils de Lyon

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited at 22 centres in six countries (Austria, the Czech Republic, Germany, France, Italy and Poland), including 17 centres in five countries (the Czech Republic, Germany, France, Italy and Poland) which enrolled patients.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A screening visit was performed four to seven days prior to Baseline (Day -7 to Day -4). At Baseline, 47 subjects were randomised in a ratio of 5:2:5:2 to one of the four treatment groups.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of the average Daily IEF change from baseline to DAY 84 using ANCOVA with the baseline average daily IEF value as covariate.
analysis.p_value_desc: No multiplicity adjustment applied: each test conducted at a 5% significance level.

outcome.title: Quality of Life (QoL) Total Summary Score
outcome.description: Mean Change from Baseline in Short Form (SF)-Qualiveen Questionnaire Calculated Total Score. The SF-Qualiveen questionnaire is a specific health related QoL questionnaire validated for urinary disorders in subjects with neurological conditions containing 8 items looking at four scales: limitations (2 items); constraints (2 items); fears (2 items) and feelings (2 items). The 8 items each having a 5-point Likert-type scale ranging from 0=“Not at all” to 4=“Extremely” for the first 6 items, from 0=“Never” to 4=“Always” for item 7 and from 0=”Always” to 4=”Never” for item 8. The score per scale has been calculated as the mean of the two items. In case of one missing item among the 2 items for a given scale, the score has not been calculated. Total score has been calculated as the mean of all the items completed among the 8 items. Lower scores indicate a better QoL (i.e. no limitations, fears, constraints, or negative feelings) and higher scores indicate poorer QoL.
outcome.population: Analysis based on number of subjects in the Intent to Treat (ITT) population.

measure.title: Quality of Life (QoL) Total Summary Score
measure.description: Mean Change from Baseline in Short Form (SF)-Qualiveen Questionnaire Calculated Total Score. The SF-Qualiveen questionnaire is a specific health related QoL questionnaire validated for urinary disorders in subjects with neurological conditions containing 8 items looking at four scales: limitations (2 items); constraints (2 items); fears (2 items) and feelings (2 items). The 8 items each having a 5-point Likert-type scale ranging from 0=“Not at all” to 4=“Extremely” for the first 6 items, from 0=“Never” to 4=“Always” for item 7 and from 0=”Always” to 4=”Never” for item 8. The score per scale has been calculated as the mean of the two items. In case of one missing item among the 2 items for a given scale, the score has not been calculated. Total score has been calculated as the mean of all the items completed among the 8 items. Lower scores indicate a better QoL (i.e. no limitations, fears, constraints, or negative feelings) and higher scores indicate poorer QoL.
measure.population: Analysis based on number of subjects in the Intent to Treat (ITT) population.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of the Quality of Life Total Summary score change from baseline to DAY 14 using ANCOVA with the baseline Quality of Life Total Summary score as covariate.
Comparison of the Quality of Life Total Summary score change from baseline to DAY 14 using ANCOVA with the baseline Quality of Life Total Summary score as covariate.
Comparison of the Quality of Life Total Summary score change from baseline to DAY 42 using ANCOVA with the baseline Quality of Life Total Summary score as covariate.

Comparison of the Quality of Life Total Summary score change from baseline to DAY 84 using ANCOVA with the baseline Quality of Life Total Summary score as covariate.

outcome.title: Pain Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Score: Before Treatment Injection
outcome.description: Pain assessment using the VAS. The VAS is a 100-mm (10-cm) scoring scale. Score range on VAS is from 0 to 100 where zero [0] indicates no pain and 100 indicates worst possible pain.
outcome.population: Analysis based on number of subjects in the Safety population with a valid value.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
